WRITING.TITLE: Getting people telling me Nazi military technology was actually inferior to the allies who is right?
WRITING.TEXT:
So on a post on the Man in the High Castle Reddit we were debating what a future world would look like if the Nazi's won.
Someone said the idea that the Nazi's were technology advanced was a 'myth' created by Hollywood. While I am not certain they were in all aspects I cited some examples to show how they were superior.
-I said the Tiger tanks were better than the American Sherman. (German tanks are what most American ones are based on today)
-I said the MG42 generally performed better than the American browning (higher RPM, more portable, easy for a single person to use)
-I said the STG-44, the worlds first assault rifle, was better for assault manoeuvres than the BAR. (Also what inspired Kalashnikov design for the AK-47)
-I said the panserfaust, the RPG predecessor, was better in combat for being operated by a single user and it's portability than the M2 bazooka. (Debatable I know)
-I said the Nazi's rocket program (missiles and planes-V1 and V2's) was unparalleled and many of their scientist would be driving forces behind the Soviet and US space programs.
-all cited some of their wonder weapon programs like night vision etc
I was told all of the above is inaccurate. I am a third year history student and a really good UK university, I would be very surprised if everything I said ^ wasn't at least up for debate rather than being told Hollywood has brainwashed me into thinking the above is true.
Panserfaust could be used by one man and didn't need a second operator like the M2 how am I wrong? Maybe you should go and ask if the Tiger was better than the Sherman - it was
How is it wrong ? Tiger tank was fucking notorious for being one of the best and hardest to destroy. STG-44 was known for how well it worked in an assault situation
I don't believe i nmagicccc... ONWARDSSSSSSS!!!!

During the 1800's Germany was largely left out of the land grab of Asia and many other parts of the world (I guess partly because it wasn't unified until 1871)
Germany motive in WW1 was about created their Empire in Europe - so maybe that's why it's relevant to Price-the ambition to create a greater global empire for himself? Thus growing his power

In a lot of the technologies that were essential to the war-Germany was ahead. The Tiger tank was years ahead of its time and completely outdid all the other nations tanks. Their weaponry was superior - MP-40 was better than the Thompson, Stg-44 was better than the BAR, MG-42 was better than the Browning. Panserfaust was better than the M2 Bazooka-sure America were ahead in some respect in a lot of technology but Nazi's were superior than most of world in a lot. Rockets, missiles, rocket planes were all unmatched.

The Germans had a couple of prototype that ran on rockets essentially including suicide craft - so I definitely believe they would have that kind of 'rocket plane' but could have developed normally too. It impossible to tell but Nazi's were far ahead in many respects - I take your point about they getting rid of a lot of scientist and Hitler didn't focus on the A-Bomb - theirs was nowhere near complete by the end of the war

WRITING.TITLE: Found something interesting about 'White Rose' when looking into anti-Nazi resistance in Germany
WRITING.TEXT:
'Of the Germans who opposed Hitler's dictatorship, very few groups openly protested the Nazi genocide against Jews. The "White Rose" movement was founded in June 1942 by Hans Scholl, a 24-year-old medical student at the University of Munich, his 22-year-old sister Sophie, and 24-year-old Christoph Probst. Although the exact origin of the name "White Rose" is unknown, it clearly stands for purity and innocence in the face of evil. Hans, Sophie, and Christoph were outraged that educated Germans went along with Nazi policies. They distributed anti-Nazi leaflets and painted slogans like "Freedom!" and "Down With Hitler!" on walls of the university. In February 1943, Hans and Sophie Scholl were caught distributing leaflets and arrested. Together with their friend Christoph, they were executed four days later. Hans's last words were "Long live freedom!"'
I know White Rose is a character and not FSociety but find it interesting that the White Rose movement is an anti-Nazi/Govt movement led by a man and his younger sister (like Elliot and Darlene). It may not be linked at all but interesting nonetheless.
In Wolfenstein the Nazi's control the world in High Castle Japan rule Asia

I strongly disagree with you - the Nazi's were technologically advanced in many ways - who had the best tanks; which today's modern tanks are based on? The Nazi's. who created the worlds first assault rifle which the AK-47 is based on? The Nazi's. who invented the first proper rockets/missiles? Who invented the best portable rocket launcher?The Nazi's. who had developed night vision? Who knew smoking gave you lung cancer? Who had the best weapons? Who had, generally, the best vehicles? Apart from America (who they were a head of), militarily the Nazi's were far more advanced than any other army in The world.
Guess what scientist were instrumental in creating the US and Soviet space programs? Yep the Nazi scientist captured after the war.

WRITING.TITLE: Band of Brothers Vs The Pacific - which is more entertaining? Which depicts war better?
WRITING.TEXT: So I've just re-watched them back to back. Band of Brothers certainly does have a better narrative and more memorable characters overall, but I feel The Pacific is a lot better in really showing the horror and randomness of war. Characters like Snafu are amazing and the morality of war is a lot more in question in this series I think. The savagery of the fighting in The Pacific makes it a harder watch and to me it's a lot more impactful. What do you guys think?

WRITING.TITLE: Does anyone else constantly think about this game?
WRITING.TEXT:
So I've beaten the game twice, hearts of stone twice, and Blood and Wine once. I think about this game a lot and I've first played it on release day. I remember playing 12am-6am for 7 nights consecutively and just absolutely loving every moment. I finished my second play through in the summer choosing a different ending (empress one aka the best one) and just can't stop thinking about it.
My god that last moment in B+W made me so happy, I wish I could play it again for the first time. Now I just remember all the cool moments, great characters and just the feeling I got when playing it. Sorry for my rambling but I guess many of you guys feel the same! Just wanted to share it is the greatest game of all time - no debate
